messages.message: @Chris Cowell I find the API documentation confusing for output workspace. Can we clarify that for both community and organization accounts, the default is that the app will run in the users personal workspace?

Chris is out but I can take a stab at it. @hannah How does this look (not sure we need to note the output file path format if we just state where it saves to) ----

> The workspace in which to run the app. The output is saved to the default drive of the specified workspace. If not defined, the app runs in your personal workspace and the output saves to your personal workspace’s default drive.
>   
> *Note:* Service accounts don’t have personal workspaces. When making this call from a service account, you must specify a value for either `output_workspace` or `output_dir`.

I was making a pass over the docs yesterday and found this confusion as well. Is it necessary to mention drive everywhere?

For example in batch we have
```The name of the workspace in which to add the batch; the batch is created in the default drive of the workspace. If not specified, the default location for organization members is the default drive of your personal workspace. For community users, the default location is your personal workspace's Instabase Drive.```
For app run above, my suggestion

```The workspace in which to run the app. By default, the app run saves output in your personal workspace. 

Note: Service accounts don't have personal workspaces. When making this call from a service account, you must specify a value for either `output_workspace` or `output_dir`.```
I like that simplification as well - I think we should just be talking in terms of workspaces we don't need to talk about the default drive of the workspace in each of these contexts
Okey dokey, Anil I’ll let you make the change—thank you!
https://github.com/instabase/aihub-openapi/pull/21/files - just created a PR for this
